revised_title: Petrifactions of the Earliest European Angiosperms: A Study of Fossilized Stems
tldr: This paper presents the discovery and analysis of the earliest known petrified stems of angiosperms from the Aptian period (Lower Greensand) in England. The three specimens, belonging to three new genera, provide valuable insights into the early history of angiosperms and their anatomy, which was previously unknown in this geological time period.
